testSuite.name: MPA Comprehensive Evaluation Suite
testSuite.description: Full behavioral testing for Media Planning Agent including complex multi-turn scenarios, non-linear navigation, data changes, RAG validation, and self-referential learning

targetScores.description: All scorers must achieve 95% or higher for production readiness

acronym_definition.description: All acronyms defined on first use

source_citation.description: All data claims have source attribution

idk_protocol.description: Models with assumption when user uncertain

proactive_intelligence.description: Calculates and researches when data available

progress_over_perfection.description: Makes progress with assumptions vs blocking

step_completion.description: Knows when step is complete and advances

testScenarios.name: Complete Linear Flow - B2B SaaS
testScenarios.description: Full 10-step journey for B2B SaaS lead generation campaign

turns.user: Hi, I need help creating a media plan.
We want to generate qualified leads for our B2B software product.
A qualified lead is someone who books a demo with our sales team.
We want 500 demo bookings this quarter. Our budget is $150,000.
Is that a realistic target?
What's the typical lifetime value for customers in this space?
Our average contract is $50,000 annually with 80% gross margin.
Who should we be targeting?
IT directors and CIOs at mid-market companies, 500-5000 employees, in financial services and healthcare.
Where should we focus geographically?
US only, focused on major metros - NYC, SF, Chicago, Boston, LA.
We already said our budget is $150K. What else do you need?
The campaign runs Q2, April through June.
What makes our product unique is that we reduce compliance costs by 40% guaranteed.
Now what channels should we use?
Why LinkedIn over other options?
What about Google?
How should we split the budget across channels?
How do we measure success?
Should we use ROAS as our primary metric?
What should we test?
What are the biggest risks?
Can you summarize the complete plan?
Actually, our budget just got cut to $100K. What changes?
Give me the final updated plan.

testScenarios.name: Complete Linear Flow - DTC E-commerce
testScenarios.description: Full 10-step journey for DTC e-commerce customer acquisition

turns.user: I need a media plan for our direct-to-consumer skincare brand.
We want to acquire new customers profitably.
A new customer is someone who makes their first purchase.
We have $500,000 for the year and want 10,000 new customers.
Our average order value is $85 and we have 40% gross margin.
Our target customer is women 25-45 interested in clean beauty and sustainability.
They shop at Sephora and Whole Foods, follow beauty influencers, and care about ingredients.
We sell nationwide in the US.
No concentration - we want national coverage.
Budget is spread evenly across the year with a bump for Q4 holiday.
60% in Q4, 40% spread across Q1-Q3.
Our differentiator is we're the only brand with USDA organic certification and plastic-free packaging.
What channels work best for DTC beauty?
How should we allocate budget across channels?
What CPMs should we expect?
How do we know if it's working?
What's incrementality testing?
What should we test first?
What are the biggest risks to this plan?
Summarize the plan.
Wait, I forgot to mention we also sell on Amazon. Does that change anything?
About 40% of our sales are on Amazon.
How does that change the budget allocation?
Final summary with Amazon included.

testScenarios.name: Non-Linear Navigation - Jump Ahead
testScenarios.description: User jumps to channels before completing outcomes

turns.user: Hi, I need a media plan for a mobile game launch.
Should we use TikTok or Instagram for this?
I really want to know about channels first.
Fine. We want 100,000 app installs.
Budget is $200,000.
OK now can we talk about channels?
Go back - who should we target?
Casual gamers, 18-35, who play puzzle and word games.
Does that change your channel recommendations?
What about measurement?
We skipped geography and budget allocation.
US only, even split across months.
What's still missing?
Fill in reasonable defaults for the rest.
Summarize everything including what you assumed.
Media plan for a fitness app. Skip the intro, I know the process.
Objective: 50K paid subscribers. Budget: $1M. Skip audience and geography, I'll handle those.
Jump to channels.
Recommend allocation percentages.
Actually, target audience is women 25-40 interested in yoga and mindfulness.
Does that change the allocation?
Skip measurement and testing. Go to risks.
What are we missing that's critical?
LTV is $300 with 70% margin.
Summarize what we have and what's still TBD.
Fill in measurement with reasonable defaults.
Final complete plan.
Media plan for launching a new CRM product.
Goal is 1,000 enterprise sales demos. Budget is $2 million.
Target: IT decision makers at Fortune 1000 companies.
Focus on US, major business hubs.
Even monthly spend over 12 months.
What channels do you recommend?
Bad news - budget just got cut to $500K. Everything else stays the same.
Is the original goal still achievable?
What if we reduced the target to 300 demos?
How does this change the channel mix?
What trade-offs am I making?
Can we be more efficient if we narrow the audience?
Go with healthcare IT only.
Final plan with all the changes.
Media plan for our meal kit delivery service.
Objective is brand awareness. We want 50 million impressions.
Budget is $300K, target is health-conscious millennials.
What channels work best for awareness?
Actually, leadership just changed priorities. We need to pivot to customer acquisition instead.
New goal: 5,000 first-time orders. Same budget.
How does the channel mix change?
What about the audience - does that need to change?
Measurement must have changed too.
What were the biggest changes from the pivot?
Are there any elements that stayed the same?
Final acquisition-focused plan.

testScenarios.name: RAG Performance - Benchmark Retrieval
testScenarios.description: Tests retrieval of benchmark data from knowledge base

turns.user: What's a typical CPM for LinkedIn advertising?
How does that compare to Facebook?
What about conversion rates for B2B lead gen?
What's typical CAC for fintech apps?
How about e-commerce DTC brands?
What's a good ROAS benchmark for fashion?
What channels work best for B2B SaaS?
What about mobile gaming user acquisition?
How much should I budget for testing?
What's the typical attribution window for different channels?

testScenarios.name: RAG Performance - Web Search Validation
testScenarios.description: Tests mandatory web search for efficiency validation

turns.user: We have $100K to acquire 2,000 customers for our crypto trading app.
How does that compare to traditional fintech?
What's the latest on iOS privacy changes affecting this?
We're targeting Gen Z crypto investors specifically.
What channels are they most responsive to?
What's TikTok CPM running these days for fintech?
Any regulatory considerations I should know about?
Summarize with all your sourced data.

testScenarios.name: Self-Referential Learning - Context Retention
testScenarios.description: Tests ability to reference and build on earlier conversation

turns.user: Media plan for ABC Corp's new product launch.
Lead generation for our enterprise security software. 500 leads, $400K budget.
Target: CISOs and security directors at companies with 1000+ employees.
Focus on healthcare and financial services verticals.
What was our budget again?
And the target number of leads?
Continue with channels.
Actually, let me add that our average deal size is $150K.
Does that change anything?
What company are we planning for again?
What verticals did we say?
Provide a summary so far.
Add technology vertical too.
Final summary with all updates.
List every piece of information I gave you.

testScenarios.name: I Don't Know Protocol - User Uncertainty
testScenarios.description: Tests handling when user doesn't have information

turns.user: Media plan for a new coffee brand.
Customer acquisition. Not sure how many we need.
Budget is around $200K. I don't know what a realistic target is.
I don't know our customer LTV either.
I'm not sure who our target customer is exactly.
No idea about geography either.
Continue with assumptions.
What have you assumed so far?
Actually I know our margin is 65%.
Final plan with assumptions clearly marked.

testScenarios.name: Adaptive Sophistication - Basic User
testScenarios.description: Tests language adaptation for unsophisticated user

turns.user: Hi I need help with advertising for my small business.
I sell homemade candles online.
I want more customers. I have about $5000 to spend.
What's a realistic goal for that budget?
What advertising should I use?
I heard about something called ROAS. What is that?
This is all new to me. Am I doing okay?
Give me a simple plan I can understand.

testScenarios.name: Adaptive Sophistication - Expert User
testScenarios.description: Tests language adaptation for sophisticated user

turns.user: Need to optimize our media mix for a $2M B2B SaaS campaign targeting enterprise MQLs.
Current CAC is $800, LTV:CAC is 4:1, targeting 2500 MQLs at 20% SQL conversion.
ABM heavy, intent data overlay, looking at 6sense vs Bombora.
What's your view on incrementality measurement for LinkedIn ABM?
We're seeing platform ROAS of 3.2x but incrementality tests show 1.8x actual lift.
Recommendations on MMM vs MTA vs geo-lift for our measurement stack?
Skip to allocation. I know the fundamentals.
Executive summary with the key decisions and trade-offs.
I have $1,000 and want 100,000 customers.
But I've heard of viral growth.
What could I realistically achieve with $1,000?
What if I increased to $10,000?
I need massive reach on a tiny budget. What's the best approach?
My competitor supposedly got 1M users with no marketing spend.
Fine, I'll be realistic. $5,000 for 500 customers.
That seems doable. Let's plan for that.
I want maximum reach but also highly targeted precision.
I want both. Reach everyone who matters.
Budget is $50K but I want Super Bowl level impact.
I want awareness AND immediate sales conversion.
Which should I prioritize?
We're a new brand so probably need awareness, but investors want conversion metrics.
How do I satisfy both needs?
Give me a plan that balances these.
